newsitem.title: UK: UK's FTSE ends firmer after stalking Dow upwards.
newsitem.headline: UK's FTSE ends firmer after stalking Dow upwards.

text.p: London's FTSE 100 share index ended higher on Thursday after creeping tentatively upwards in the wake of a rejuvenated Dow, but fears of another reversal on Wall Street capped the FTSE's gains and kept volume subdued.

The blue-chip index ended 20.9 points higher at 4,228.4. Analysts said the gain had been inspired by the Dow, which climbed 83 points on Wednesday and was up a further 23 as London closed, but the FTSE remained reluctant to get carried away.
"The Dow has been incredibly volatile," said Credit Lyonnais Laing strategist Savvas Savouri. "The intraday movement has been so violent recently there's no discernable trend to follow."
